conclusion: To determine heat exchange Q, analyze changes in internal energy and work done using the first law of thermodynamics.
For an ideal gas, change in internal energy is related to temperature through ΔU = nC_V ΔT.
Work done by the gas can be calculated as W = -∫p dV.
Segment AB is a horizontal line from V1 = 3 L to V2 = 4 L.
Calculate work done in segment AB: W_AB = -p ΔV = -10^5 J.
Segment BC is a horizontal line from V2 = 4 L to V3 = 4 L.
No work is done in segment BC: W_BC = 0 J.
Segment CD is a horizontal line from V3 = 4 L to V4 = 3 L.
Calculate work done in segment CD: W_CD = -0.75 × 10^5 J.
Segment DA is a vertical line from V4 = 3 L to V1 = 3 L.
No work is done in segment DA: W_DA = 0 J.
Sum up total work done over the cycle: W_total = -1.75 × 10^5 J.
For a complete cycle, the internal energy change ΔU is zero.
Determine net heat transfer: Q = ΔU + W = -1.75 × 10^5 J.
The absolute value of heat exchange is |Q| = 1.75 × 10^5 J.
